content: the seeds of liber ation are sewn in solidarity tunisian crochet pattern @sammenstitch watermelon neckerchief 66 cm the watermelon is constructed by working 1 the foundation row of the rind in black green and white and then 2 the red flesh after completing the row necessary to achieve the desired length in the foundation row stitches are worked in short row across to create the curve edges are finished with a single_crochet to prevent curling yarn this top was designed using knitting for olive s pure silk a fingering weight yarn notions the approximate amounts required abbreviations tapestry needle stitch markers 24g of blood orange tss tunisian simple 4 7g of coal stitch 2 8g of olive fwp forward pass hooks 1 4g of putty retp return pass chain chain tunisian crochet hook you can use any yarn of st s stitch es size 5mm with wire with any weight but please stm stitch marker the recommended yarn adjust the hook and lts last stitch worked number of cast on edge stitch crochet hook 2 5 stitches for desired size @sammenstitch 2 mc 5 91 pattern nb unless otherwise noted the beginning stitch on the hook and lts need to be counted foundation row my preferred method for the foundation row is the crochet cast on method which combines the chain and fwp see here for a tutorial cast on 131 sts with your black yarn continue with a retp row 2 work your fwp of all stitches in tss remembering to keep your lts with similar gauge as the first stitch to create even row retp row 3-4 repeat row 2 on row 4 you will switch colours to green by pulling your new yarn through the final two loops of the retp row 5-9 tss all stitches retp on row 10 you will switch colours to white by pulling your new yarn through the final two loops of the retp row 10 tss all stitches retp you will switch colours to red by pulling your new yarn through the final two loops of the retp row 11 tss all stitches retp row 12 find the middle your work stitch 66 and mark the st with a stm tss all stitches in your fwp work your retp to your stm continue your retp for 10 more sts hold the remaining pulled up loops on your wire row 13 begin your fwp in tss as you would normally to your stm continue your fwp for 10 sts as you did in your retp in row 12 retp working a total of 10 + 2 sts row 14- penultimate row as per the below diagram for each row you will work each fwp adding 2 sts at the end and a retp working 2 addition sts final row work all stitches +1 by binding off in pattern do not cut yarn finishing using the working yarn work single_crochet sts across the red-coloured sts in the last red st change to black
